intro: Banisteriopsis acapulcensis, commonly known as the Acapulco bittersweet, is a climbing shrub native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by fleshy, red berries.
